item.description:
10 AM The Hills Are Alive!!- Sunday Oct 17th, 2010

From one of the highest points in Sturbridge you will enjoy 84 acres of spectacular views few have seen since the stagecoaches carried businessmen, politicians, as well as area families on this very trail located on historic Heins Farm. Enjoy a look back in history to see the last remains of the Old Worcester - Stafford Turnpike (circa 1810-1835) making its way across the site. Bring a camera. 2.5 mi., approximately 2 hrs. Dogs on leases are welcome. Free to the public. Sponsored by: Sturbridge Historic Commission.

Sturbridge, MA - UPDATED DIRECTIONS: Main St./Rte. 20: turn left onto Stallion Hill Rd as if you were going to Old Sturbridge Village entrance (note that traveling West-bound you can not take a direct left), keep going down Stallion Hill Rd, and at the end take left onto Leadmine Road. Follow for ~ 1 mile to parking lot (meeting location) on left marked "Trek- Trailhead Parking". There will also be signs posted in the area. Contact info: 508-347-0107 (Joseph at Heins Farm)


Everyone should meet Jessica at the Trek Trailhead Parking lot on Leadmine Road at 9:40am! Please call her Sunday morning before 9:30 am (508-847-7662) if you have RSVP'd "Yes" but can no longer attend this event.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be driving my silver Isuzu Rodeo.

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Heins Farm Click and Shoot Sturbridge MA
